    },
      {
        "aliases": null,
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-32933/",
        "date_added": "2010-10-19 20:47:19",
        "date_last_updated": "2018-06-25 08:51:28",
        "deck": "The third installment in the series sees a reluctant victim battling nature, pirates, and the island's insanity-inducing jungle to rescue his friends and family from an island paradise gone horribly wrong.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Far Cry 3 is an <a href=\"/open-world/3015-207/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-207\">open-world</a> <a href=\"/games/?sort=release_date&amp;filter_type=genre&amp;filter_value=32/\">first-person shooter</a> which tells the story of <a href=\"/jason-brody/3005-19174/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19174\">Jason Brody</a> and his friends, as they mistakenly land on Rook Island, a tropical paradise that is inhabited by brutal pirates, slave traffickers, and deadly animal predators. The game was developed by <a href=\"/ubisoft-montreal-studios/3010-1559/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1559\">Ubisoft Montreal</a> for <a href=\"/xbox-360/3045-20/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a>, <a href=\"/playstation-3/3045-35/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a> and <a href=\"/pc/3045-94/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> using an updated version of the Dunia Engine used in <a href=\"/far-cry-2/3030-20665/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20665\">Far Cry 2</a>. The multiplayer part of the game was developed by <a href=\"/ubisoft-massive/3010-3421/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-3421\">Ubisoft Massive</a>. It was released on November 29, 2012 in Europe, Africa and Middle Eastern territories and December 4, 2012 in North America.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure style=\"width: 1279px\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334277\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png\" data-ratio=\"0.55824863174355\" data-width=\"1279\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334277\"><img alt=\"Weapons and modifications can be bought in stores.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png 1279w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2334277-picture_2.png 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Weapons and modifications can be bought in stores.</figcaption></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Far Cry 3 is set on a tropical island archipelago. Gameplay involves battling various island factions as well as the occasional wildlife. As with the previous installment, missions can be accepted from various <a href=\"/non-player-character/3015-967/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-967\">NPC</a>s throughout the world. <a href=\"/optional-objective/3015-3461/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3461\">Side missions</a> such as running deliveries and hunting can be completed for extra cash. Animals that can be encountered include tigers, bears, sharks, deer, and komodo dragons. The player also has multiple vehicles at their disposal, including jeeps, ATVs, jet skis, and hang gliders.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Various towns and outposts are scattered across the island. Attacking and securing enemy outposts allows the player to take control of them. In addition to acting as <a href=\"/fast-travel/3015-676/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-676\">fast travel</a> hubs, controlling outposts opens up missions in the surrounding area and gives the player access to <a href=\"/shopping/3015-1103/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1103\">shops</a>. Weapons and upgrades can be purchased here, and items discovered in the world such as <a href=\"/pelt/3055-3946/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-3946\">animal skins</a> can be sold as well. Players are given a strong incentive to reset radio towers throughout the island in-order to unlock new weapons in the shops. Resetting radio towers also results in a more detailed mapping of that part of the island, similar to the \"syncing\" mechanic in the <a href=\"/assassins-creed/3025-38/\" data-ref-id=\"3025-38\">Assassin's Creed</a> series.</p><figure style=\"width: 816px\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2378557\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.55147058823529\" data-width=\"816\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.1%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2378557\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg 816w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378557-far_cry_3_the_heron_skill_tree.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Far Cry 3 rewards players with <a href=\"/experience-points/3015-39/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-39\">experience</a> for completing missions and executing various kill moves, which then feeds into a <a href=\"/skill-tree/3015-382/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-382\">skill tree system</a>. Players can choose to spend skill points in three separate trees, each pertaining to a different style of play. Spending skill points allows the player to unlock perks, such as increasing the amount of health Jason has, increasing reload speed, and unlocking a myriad close quarters kill moves.</p><h2>Plot</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Like other games in the series, Far Cry 3 has no ties to the previous stories told in the Far Cry franchise. The characters, locales, and plot are all self-contained.</p><figure style=\"width: 1280px\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2378553\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1280\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2378553\"><img alt=\"Jason and his friends partying.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Jason and his friends partying.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/6/60551/2378553-far_cry_3_story_trailer_2.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Jason and his friends partying.</figcaption></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Jason Brody and his friends head to a remote tropical island while on vacation, but things take a turn for the worse when they are all kidnapped by pirates, who are led by the insane &amp; sadistic Vaas Montenegro. Jason narrowly escapes, and soon finds himself caught in the middle of a bloody power struggle for the island between the native Rakyat population and the occupying pirate forces.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Jason quickly allies himself with the natives after being saved by Dennis Rogers, who introduces him to Citra (Vaas' sister). She informs him that while Vaas is certainly an enemy, the real threat is Hoyt Volker, a brutal human trafficker that is using the islands for his smuggling ring. He has corrupted Vaas with drugs and money, and has given him control of the entire northern island. Jason vows to kill Vaas and free his friends, and one by one he brings his friends to Doctor Earnhart, a man who agrees to help Jason and his friends. They find an old broken down boat nearby, and as Jason progresses through the story, they stay back and make repairs.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">As time goes by, the Rakyat (and to certain extent Jason himself) start to believe that Jason is the reincarnation of the Rakyat's mythical warrior ancestor. Citra and her followers revere him, and implore him to stay and liberate their people. Jason agrees, and eventually hooks up with Willis Huntley, a CIA operative working on the island who helps him track down Vaas. Once Vaas is killed, Willis sends Jason off to the south island to connect with Sam Becker, another operative who is in deep undercover working directly with Hoyt. Sam helps Jason get close to Hoyt, and Jason is able to destroy Hoyt's smuggling ring and kill Hoyt in a knife fight, and save his brother Riley from captivity.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Jason &amp; Riley go back to Earnhart and the boat, only to find everything on fire, his friends missing, and Earnhart mortally wounded. He tells Jason that Citra is responsible, and when Jason confronts Cirta at her temple, the player is <a href=\"/multiple-endings/3015-27/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-27\">given a choice to end the game</a>; kill his friends and stay on the island forever, or free his friends and leave behind the Rakyat people.</p><h2><b>Characters</b></h2><h3>Jason Brody</h3><figure style=\"width: 1102px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334603\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.95099818511797\" data-width=\"1102\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:95.1%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334603\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 1102w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 1102w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334603-far_cry_3_far_cry_3_far_cry_jason_brody2.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">The protagonist of Far Cry 3, <a href=\"/jason-brody/3005-19174/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19174\">Jason Brody</a> is a 25-year-old from Los Angeles. He starts out with no real combat experience, and has to learn and adapt to the island's dangers in order to survive.</p><h3>Vaas Montenegro</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2702438\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.56222547584187\" data-width=\"1366\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1366px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.2%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2702438\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 1366w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 1366w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/9/97594/2702438-vaas-far-cry-3-18127-1366x768.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/vaas/3005-19175/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19175\">Vaas Montenegro</a> is the leader of the pirates, who deals in murder, torture, and slave trading. He's sadistic and more than a little bit crazy. His men control most of the northern island.</p><h3>Citra Talugmai</h3><figure style=\"width: 724px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334605\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png\" data-ratio=\"0.9792817679558\" data-width=\"724\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:97.9%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334605\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png 724w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png 724w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334605-picture_3.png 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/citra-montenegro/3005-25163/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25163\">Citra</a> is Vaas' sister, but she has strong connections with the native Rakyat, and makes herself an ally to Jason in fighting against Vaas.</p><h3>Dennis Rogers</h3><figure style=\"width: 714px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414148\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg\" data-ratio=\"1.0756302521008\" data-width=\"714\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:107.6%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414148\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 892px) 100vw, 892px\" data-width=\"892\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg 714w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414148-farcry3_dennis.jpg 714w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 892px) 100vw, 892px\" data-width=\"892\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/dennis-rogers/3005-25166/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25166\">Dennis Rogers</a> is the man that saves Jason after he initially escapes from Vaas. Dennis also gives him his first bit of cash and introduces him to the Rakyat people and their struggle.</p><h3>Doctor Earnhardt</h3><figure style=\"width: 1218px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334608\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.99753694581281\" data-width=\"1218\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:99.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2334608\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 1218w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 1218w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/60551/2334608-2156225_doctor_earnhardt.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/doctor-earnhardt/3005-22693/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-22693\">Earnhardt</a> is a dubious ally of Jason's. He provides shelter, medical assistance, and supplies, but is also deeply involved with the more psychedelic aspects of island life.</p><h3>Willis Huntley</h3><figure style=\"width: 907px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2391147\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.72326350606395\" data-width=\"907\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:72.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2391147\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg 907w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg 907w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/11512/2391147-fc3_willis.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/willis-huntley/3005-25169/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25169\">Willis Huntley</a> is an ex-CIA operative living on the island. Although he has long lost contact with his superiors, he is still gathering intelligence about Hoyt and Vaas, and is able to help point Jason in the right direction, eventually introducing him to Sam Becker.</p><h3>Sam Becker</h3><figure style=\"width: 306px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414149\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png\" data-ratio=\"1.1535947712418\" data-width=\"306\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:115.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414149\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 306px) 100vw, 306px\" data-width=\"306\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png 306w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414149-fc3sam.png 306w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 306px) 100vw, 306px\" data-width=\"306\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/sam-becker/3005-25170/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25170\">Sam Becker</a> is a CIA operative in deep cover within Hoyt Volker's slave trafficking ring. He is located on the Southern island, and agrees to help Jason get to Volker after being referred by Willis.</p><h3>Hoyt Volker</h3><figure style=\"width: 1336px\" data-size=\"medium\" data-align=\"right\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414151\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.80838323353293\" data-width=\"1336\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:80.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2414151\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 1336w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 1336w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/6/63119/2414151-hoyt_volker.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><a href=\"/hoyt-volker/3005-25164/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25164\">Hoyt Volker</a> is a brutal slave trafficker who controls the southern island, backed up by an army of well-armed mercenaries.</p><h2>Skills</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Jason unlocks skill points by gaining XP throughout the game. Each point can go into one of three branches in the skill tree, and each one has unique abilities and takedowns.</p><h3>The Heron</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><i>Mobility and long ranged takedowns.</i></p><ul><li><b>Long Gun Expert</b>: Improves hip-fire accuracy for assault rifles, sniper rifles, and LMGs.</li><li><b>Aimed Reload</b>: It lets the pistol and sniper rifle quickly reload while aiming.</li><li><b>Hip Shooter</b>: Improves hip-fire accuracy for pistols, SMGs, and shotguns.</li><li><b>Enhanced Syringe Potency</b>: Crafted syringes will last 50% longer when used.</li><li><b>Syringe Potency</b>: Crafted syringes will last 25% longer when used.</li><li><b>Cook Grenade</b>: Cooked grenade lets you hold grenade for seconds, but don't hold it longer before it explodes.</li><li><b>Cool Gunner</b>: Mounted guns can be fired longer before it heats.</li><li><b>Soft Landing</b>: Reduce fall damage by 25%.</li><li><b>Line Gunner</b>: Shoot while using ziplines for one-handed weapons.</li><li><b>Steady Aim</b>: Steady aim will last 2x longer when looking through scope.</li><li><b>Gunslinger Takedown</b>: Steal enemy's weapon and use it to kill others nearby. Adds x5 XP per pistol kill.</li><li><b>Death From Above</b>: Jumping onto enemy below will automatically kill him. Adds x5 XP per kill.</li><li><b>Death From Below</b>: Kills enemy above on climbable ledge. Adds x5 XP per kill.</li><li><b>Dual Death From Above</b>: Same as Death From Above but adds x7.5 XP per kill.</li><li><b>Dual Death From Below</b>: Same as Death From Below but adds x7.5 XP per kill.</li><li><b>Deep Breath</b>: Stay underwater longer before needing to surface for air.</li><li><b>Breath Control</b>: Same as Steady Aim although it last 4x longer.</li><li><b>Marathon Man</b>: Sprint or run faster.</li></ul><h3>The Shark</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><i>Healing and assault takedowns.</i></p><ul><li><b>Peak Conditioning</b>: Add an additional health slot.</li><li><b>Expert Conditioning</b>: Add an additional health slot.</li><li><b>Advanced First Aid</b>: Heal 3 slots of health without medicines.</li><li><b>Advanced Conditioning</b>: Add an additional health slots.</li><li><b>Improved First Aid</b>: Heal 2 slots of health without medicines.</li><li><b>Physical Conditioning</b>: Add an additional health slots.</li><li><b>Fire Retardant</b>: Reduce 50% damage taken from fire.</li><li><b>Field Medic</b>: Restore 4 slots of health when using medical syringes.</li><li><b>Adrenaline</b>: Regenerate one health bar 50% faster.</li><li><b>Takedown</b>: Kill nearby enemy silently and adds x3 XP per kill.</li><li><b>Ironsides</b>: Reduce 50% damage taken from explosion.</li><li><b>Evasive Driving</b>: Commandeered vehicles take 50% less damage when using evasive driving techniques.</li><li><b>Adrenaline Surge</b>: Regenerate health bars 100% faster.</li><li><b>Button Up</b>: Wearing body armor properly will absorb 50% more damage.</li><li><b>Field Surgeon</b>: Restore 6 slots of health when using medical syringes.</li><li><b>Chained Takedown</b>: String together multiple takedowns, one after another. Adds x10 XP per chained kill.</li><li><b>Grenade Takedown</b>: Pull pin on an enemy's grenade, then kick him away. Adds x5 XP per grenade kill.</li><li><b>Heavy Beatdown</b>: Heavy gunner or flamer can be killed if near. Adds x5 XP per kill.</li></ul><h3>The Spider</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><i>Survival and stealth takedowns.</i></p><ul><li><b>Nimble Hands</b>: Reload 25% faster for assault rifles, sniper rifles, and LMGs.</li><li><b>Quick Swap</b>: Swap weapon faster.</li><li><b>Nimble Finger</b>: Reload 25% faster for pistols, SMGs, and shotguns.</li><li><b>Running Reload</b>: Reload while running.</li><li><b>Takedown Drag</b>: Quickly hides bodies after performing a standard takedown.</li><li><b>Knife Throw Takedown</b>: Takedown enemy and use his knife to kill the other near him.</li><li><b>Loot Takedown</b>: Takedown enemy will automatically loot him.</li><li><b>Combat Archery</b>: Fire or draw arrow 50% faster.</li><li><b>Expert Archery</b>: Improve stability with the bow when lining up a shot.</li><li><b>Sprint Slide</b>: Can slide when sprinting.</li><li><b>Horticulture 101</b>: Receive twice as many items from plant when harvesting.</li><li><b>Zoology 101</b>: Receive twice as many items when skinning animals.</li><li><b>Penny Pincher</b>: Loot more money on killed enemies or corpse.</li><li><b>Ninja Step</b>: Greatly reduce noise made when walking or running.</li><li><b>Jungle Run</b>: Moves faster when crouching.</li><li><b>Expert Swimmer</b>: Swim 25% faster in water.</li><li><b>Stone Wall</b>: Receive less damage from animal attacks and also being knocked down by enemies.</li><li><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><b>Dealmaker</b>: Receive 25% more money when selling looted items.</p></li></ul><h2>Weapons</h2><h4>Handguns</h4><table><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Real World Equivalent</th><th>Price ($)</th><th>Attachments</th><th>Stats</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>M1911</td><td><a href=\"/m1911/3055-61/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-61\">1911 (Kimber Warrior XIX</a></p></td><td>$1,300</td><td>None</td></tr></tbody></table><h4>SMGs</h4><table><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Real World Equivalent</th><th>Price Sight</li><li>Red Dot Sight</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h4>Shotguns</h4><table><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Real World Equivalent</th><th>Price SPAS-12</a></td><td>$1,600</td><td><ul><li>Extended Magazine</li><li>Red Dot Sight</li><li>Reflex Sight</li><li>Night Optics</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td>M133</td><td><a Sight</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h4>Assault Rifles</h4><table><thead><tr><th>Name</th><th>Real World Equivalent</th><th>Price ($)</th><th>Attachments</th><th>Stats</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>AK-47</td><td><a href=\"/ak-103/3055-4296/\" a set # of relics</td><td><ul><li>Reflex Sight</li><li>Suppressor</li><li>Extended Magazine</li><li>Custom Paint</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h4>Other Miscellaneous Equipment</h4><ul><li><a href=\"/flare-gun/3055-1001/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1001\">Flare Gun</a>: A single-shot weapon, usually used to distract enemy's attention.</li><li><a href=\"/knife/3055-295/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-295\">Knife</a>: One of the main items, used to kill enemy silently and skin animal.</li><li><a href=\"/anti-tank-mine/3055-1411/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1411\">Mine</a>: Detonates when enemy's is near at it.</li><li><a href=\"/m67-fragmentation-grenade/3055-3497/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-3497\">Grenade</a>: Reduce to detonation by \"cooking\" it, but don't hold it for to long.</li><li><a href=\"/c4/3055-896/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-896\">C4</a>: Detonates whenever you want by a remote.</li><li><a href=\"/molotov-cocktail/3055-75/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-75\">Molotov</a>: Creates huge amount of fire at grasses, can be crafted as fire arrows.</li><li>Repair Tool: An oxyacetylene torch that repairs any land and water vehicles.</li><li><a href=\"/camera/3055-247/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-247\">Camera</a>: The Camera viewfinder lets you use your camera to tag and track enemies and animals. It automatically tag enemies when you aim and zoom to them. Scoped weapons can also tag enemies. Enemy and animal has each type and has its own icon:</li></ul><table><thead><tr><th>Target Type</th><th>Ability</th><th>Icon</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Normal</td><td>Regular 30px) 100vw, 30px\" data-width=\"30\"></noscript></a></figure></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Multiplayer</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">In addition to the single player campaign, Far Cry 3 features competitive online multiplayer, as well as a <a href=\"/cooperative-play/3015-108/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-108\">co-op campaign mode</a>, which supports up to four players. Certain in-game actions will result in player rewards, similar to the <a href=\"/kill-streak-reward/3015-4056/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4056\">kill-streak system</a> in the <a href=\"/call-of-duty/3025-82/\" data-ref-id=\"3025-82\">Call of Duty</a> series. A 'Battle Cry' can also be performed as a boost to nearby teammates.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">A new feature introduced in multiplayer is Decoding. Players earn data sources such as hard drives, DVDs, and memory cards for completing matches in multiplayer and co-op. Once a data source has been acquired, the player can proceed to the Decoding tab to begin the process. Initially the player has access to one Decoder, but two more can be unlocked through leveling up and visiting the game's website. Once a Decoder is selected, a list of acquired data sources appears, and one can be selected. The Decoding process takes differing amounts of time depending on the probability of receiving a high ranking weapon mod or XP. Once the item is selected, the countdown begins, and continues even when the game is not on.</p><h3>Multiplayer Modes</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><b>Domination</b> - A <a href=\"/conquest-mode/3015-1099/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1099\">conquest</a> type game mode where you capture and hold 3 different points on a map.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><b>Team Deathmatch</b> - The standard one team vs the other, most kills win game mode.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><b>Firestorm</b> - A mode that tasks players with setting fire to two of your opponents bases at the same time. after this, teams have to make it to a radar dish while battling the ever-spreading fire, which blocks routes and paths.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\"><b>Transmission</b> - Each team attempts to obtain and control propaganda transmitters located all across the map. In order to win, your team must race to each transmitter as it is becoming active and hold it as long as possible.</p><h3>Co-op Campaign</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">A completely separate plot from the main single player story, the <a href=\"/4-player-co-op/3015-2563/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2563\">4 player co-op</a> takes place 6 months before Jason Brody arrived on the island. Four people, Callum \"the Scottish Thug\", Leonard \"the Crooked Cop\", Mikhail \"the Russian Hitman\", and Tisha \"the Ex Soldier\" are left on a cruise ship that the captain sold to the Rook Island pirates. The four players battle their way out and follow the captain onto the island, intent on getting their revenge and stealing his money. There are 6 total missions in the co-op, with an additional 2 missions available exclusively to PlayStation 3 players in the High Tides DLC released in January 2013.</p><h3>Map Editor</h3><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Another feature carried over from the previous games is an in-game map editor, allowing players to create their own custom single player &amp; multiplayer maps. These can then be shared online with other players, and the development team will curate the best maps and cycle them into the online rotation for all players to use.</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Brian Tyler composed Far Cry 3 soundtracks and it was released as a digital download on December 4, 2012. Violinist Serena McKinney was featured in track 17 called \"Further.\"</p><table><thead><tr><th>Track Number</th><th>Title</th><th>Duration</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>1.</td><td>Far Cry 3</td><td>5:34</td></tr><tr><td>2.</td><td>Heat</td><td>3:33</td></tr><tr><td>3.</td><td>The Rakyat</td><td>3:54</td></tr><tr><td>4.</td><td>Monsoon</td><td>2:52</td></tr><tr><td>5.</td><td>Falling Into a Dream</td><td>2:19</td></tr><tr><td>6.</td><td>Journey Into Madness</td><td>2:55</td></tr><tr><td>7.</td><td>Rook Island</td><td>5:21</td></tr><tr><td>8.</td><td>We Are Watching You</td><td>3:33</td></tr><tr><td>9.</td><td>Treasure of Zhang He</td><td>3:35</td></tr><tr><td>10.</td><td>Fever Dream</td><td>4:10</td></tr><tr><td>11.</td><td>Call of the Wild</td><td>3:43</td></tr><tr><td>12.</td><td>Bad Trip</td><td>5:00</td></tr><tr><td>13.</td><td>Path of the Warrior</td><td>7:10</td></tr><tr><td>14.</td><td>Lost Child</td><td>3:54</td></tr><tr><td>15.</td><td>Broken Compass</td><td>3:20</td></tr><tr><td>16.</td><td>The Giant's Head</td><td>2:09</td></tr><tr><td>17.</td><td>Further (feat. Serena McKinney)</td><td>4:03</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li>OS: Windows XP, Vista, or 7</li><li>CPU: 2.66 GHz Intel ® Core™2 Duo E6700 or 3GHz AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 6000+ or better</li><li>RAM: 4GB</li><li>HDD: 8GB free disk space</li><li>Graphics: 512 MB Graphic Memory with Shader Model 3.0 or higher</li><li>Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible</li><li>DirectX: Version 9</li></ul><h3>Recommended</h3><ul><li>OS: Windows XP, Vista, or 7</li><li>CPU: Intel Core i3-530 or AMD Phenom X2 565 or better</li><li>RAM: 6GB</li><li>HDD: 8GB free disk space</li><li>Graphics: 1 GB Graphics Memory or Shader Model 5.0 or higher.</li><li>Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible</li><li>DirectX: Version 9</li></ul><h3>Hi-Performance</h3><ul><li>OS: Windows 7</li><li>CPU: Intel Core i7-2600K or AMD FX-4150 or better</li><li>RAM: 8GB</li><li>HDD: 8GB free disk space</li><li>Graphics: 1GB Graphics Memory with Shader Model 5.0 or higher</li></ul><h3>Supported Graphics Card</h3><ul><li>ATI Radeon HD 2900/ 3000/ 4000/ 5000/ 6000/ 7000 series</li><li>Nvidia GeForce GTX 8800/ GTX 9000/ GT 200/ GT 400/ GT 500/ GT 600 series</li></ul>",

        "deck": "God of War is a soft reboot on the franchise of the same name. It sees Kratos and his son Atreus traverse a world of Norse myths.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>God of War is an action-adventure game developed by the <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/sce-studio-santa-monica/65-3664/\">Santa Monica</a> division of <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/sony-computer-entertainment-america/65-313/\">Sony Computer Entertainment</a>. It is the first in the series to be released on PlayStation 4 with a release on April 20, 2018. The game serves as a soft reboot and takes place in Norse mythology as apposed to the Greek mythology of the previous games. </p><h2>Plot</h2><p>The plot sees series protagonist <a href=\"/kratos/3005-645/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-645\">Kratos</a> acting as a mentor to his son Atreus whilst also trying to master the rage that has been his driving force in the past.</p>",

    {
        "aliases": "AC4\r\nAssassin's Creed 4: Black Flag\r\nAssassins Creed 4",
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-41518/",
        "date_added": "2013-02-07 11:56:32",
        "date_last_updated": "2021-06-03 08:19:54",
        "deck": "The sixth main installment of the Assassin's Creed franchise, set in the Caribbean during the age of piracy in the early 18th century. Players explore the memories of Edward Kenway, a charismatic pirate (turned reckless Assassin) and the grandfather of Connor Kenway, the protagonist of Assassin's Creed III.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2446741\" data-ratio=\"0.5640625\" data-width=\"640\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 640px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2446741\"><img alt=\"Assassins in the age of piracy!\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/7030/2446741-8655319571-24458.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Assassins in the age of piracy!</figcaption></figure><p>Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag is an open-world action-adventure game developed by <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/ubisoft-montreal-studios/3010-1559/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1559\">Ubisoft Montreal</a> and published by <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/ubisoft-entertainment/3010-82/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-82\">Ubisoft</a> for the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/xbox-360/3045-20/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a>, <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/playstation-3/3045-35/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a>, and <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/wii-u/3045-139/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-139\">Wii U</a> on October 29, 2013, for the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/playstation-4/3045-146/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a> (as a <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/launch-titles/3015-238/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-238\">launch title</a>) on November 15, 2013, for the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/pc/3045-94/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> on November 19, 2013, and for the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/xbox-one/3045-145/\" data-ref-id=\"3045-145\">Xbox One</a> (also as a launch title) on November 22, 2013.</p><p>The sixth main installment of the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/assassins-creed/3025-38/\" data-ref-id=\"3025-38\">Assassin's Creed</a> series (and the sequel to <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/assassins-creed-iii/3030-37494/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-37494\">Assassin's Creed III</a>), players control an unknown <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/abstergo-industries/3015-2653/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2653\">Abstergo</a> employee (in the year 2013, one year after the events of the previous game) who must sift through the memories of <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/edward-kenway/3005-25756/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25756\">Edward Kenway</a> (a notorious and reckless early-18th century <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/pirates/3015-445/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-445\">privateer</a>-turned-<a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/assassin/3015-1321/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1321\">Assassin</a> and the grandfather of <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/connor-kenway/3005-22428/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-22428\">Connor Kenway</a>) after the genetic memory of Assassin <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/desmond-miles/3005-305/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-305\">Desmond Miles</a> was uploaded into the Abstergo servers.</p><p>These memories (inside the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/animus/3055-359/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-359\">Animus</a>) take place in the year 1715 throughout the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/caribbean/3035-113/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-113\">Caribbean</a> and the southern coast of <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/florida/3035-1324/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1324\">Florida</a>. Edward, as an experienced pirate, travels through the dangerous Caribbean Sea in a major open-world naval experience (including <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/naval-battles/3015-598/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-598\">engaging passing ships</a>, surviving tropical storms, <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/fishing/3015-510/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-510\">fishing</a>/whaling, and exploring distant islands). Other pirates in the game are based on real, realistic pirates (rather than the comedic tropes associated with the era), featuring the famous <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/black-beard/3005-25760/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-25760\">Blackbeard</a>. Other pirates named include Charles Vane, Calico Jack, Anne Bonny, Ben Hornigold, and a different take on the now-famous <a href=\"/jack-sparrow/3005-2381/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2381\">Jack Sparrow</a>. A focus upon real-world occurrences, just as in previous games, will be a primary motivation for the narrative - including Bartholomew Roberts' assault on 42 Portuguese ships, the marooning of Charles Vane, and the Spanish Armada shipwreck.</p><p>Development began in the summer of 2011 by an entirely new team, as the game was being penned by the scriptwriter of <a href=\"/assassins-creed-revelations/3030-34975/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-34975\">Assassin's Creed: Revelations</a>.</p><p>The game shipped on both current and next gen consoles, with PS3 and PS4 versions including \"60 minutes of exclusive gameplay\" featuring <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/aveline-de-grandpre/3005-23439/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23439\">Aveline de Grandpre</a> from <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/assassins-creed-iii-liberation/3030-38507/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-38507\">Assassin's Creed III: Liberation</a>. Despite these claims of exclusivity, this content is also available on PC.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2446739\" data-ratio=\"0.5640625\" data-width=\"640\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 640px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2446739\"><img alt=\"Ship-boarding gameplay\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/7030/2446739-1453344187-24458.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Ship-boarding gameplay</figcaption></figure><p><strong>The World</strong></p><p>The game is an open-world naval experience with seamless boarding, tropical storms, harpooning (for whales), and underwater gameplay (exploring shipwrecks - with enemies including sharks). Approximately 40% of the game occurs across the sea, as the other 60% remains on land - with \"50 unique locations\" including fisherman villages, jungles, temples, plantations, forts, complete islands, and Mayan ruins. Each of the areas have different gameplay focuses. For example, the Mayan ruins are based around puzzle solving and platforming, while the Coconut Islands are inhabited by enemies to fight.</p><p>The three largest cities, however, are Naussau (the pirate haven), Kingston (a lively, dangerous town), and Havana (the capital of Cuba). The team that worked on <a href=\"/far-cry-3/3030-32933/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-32933\">Far Cry 3</a>'s open world design pitched in to add to the random elements and overall design of the Caribbean world. Added randomness includes storms and rain, which simple make things wet on land but add dangerous rogue waves and lack of visibility on sea.</p><p>In major ports and on minor islands, Kenway can collect treasure chests (some of which include plans for upgrades for his ship), animus fragments ( 200 glowing Macguffins of the past), sea chanties (songs for his crew to sing aboard the <em>Jackdaw), </em>and secret letters revealing the backstory of a mysterious character.</p><p>While sailing, randomly generated supplies and shipwrecked crewmen can be collected.</p><p><strong>Fighting on land</strong></p><p>With the addition of free aiming, Kenway can carry up to four guns and use them in one go. Cutlasses, swords, axes, rifles, and pistols are available. Using the d-pad, players select Kenway's primary weapons (swords, hands, or hidden blades) and his secondary weapons (pistols, smoke bombs, rope darts, sleeping darts, or berzerk darts) for use in battle. The same parry-into-combo system from previous games returns, with a successful parry and kill leading into the ability to chain kills quickly. In addition, quickly hitting the secondary button with pistols equipped will fire off a volley of up to four chained shots, potentially killing four enemies in a few seconds.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2495911\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1920\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1920px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2495911\"><img alt=\"Kenway executes an island guard\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Kenway executes an island guard\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/0/2840/2495911-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_006.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Kenway executes an island guard</figcaption></figure><p>Kenway now regains health only over time when out of battle, leaving behind the health regenerating potions of previous games. This means that the player must decide whether to run or fight it out when low on health.</p><p>Assassination techniques of air, ground, double, and running assassinations make their return. Added here is the ability to tag enemies using Eagle Vision. If the player looks at enemies for a few seconds in this vision mode, a dot will appear over their heads and, upon returning to regular vision, that enemy will be highlighted. Highlighted enemies appear through walls, making awareness of their status and tracking them (especially during eavesdropping missions) far easier.</p><p><strong>Fighting on sea</strong></p><p>Kenway's greatest ally is his ship, The <em>Jackdaw. </em>Acquired during the story, the ship grows with the player's input. Salvaging supplies from warehouses or the open sea can give the player materials to upgrade the ship, but in order to truly improve her, the player must fight, incapacitate, and board other ships. Doing so will net the greatest amount of money, crew, ammunition, and upgrade materials in the form of cloth, wood, or metal. Using a spyglass reveals what each ship is carrying, its level (strength vs. the player's strength), and its type (gunboat, schooner, brig, frigate, or man o' war).</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2578670\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1920\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1920px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2578670\"><img alt=\"During a fort battle, smaller ships often attack as well\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"During a fort battle, smaller ships often attack as well\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/2/28122/2578670-thunderbattle.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>During a fort battle, smaller ships often attack as well</figcaption></figure><p>Revising the system from Assassin's Creed III, AC IV places each type of ship-board weapon at a different location on the ship. When the player looks forward, they can fire the chain shot, which takes down enemy sails and makes them less maneuverable. Looking to either side brings up the aiming arc of the broadside cannons, the general damage weapon. Simply hitting the fire button from the side view will fire heavy shot, a flaming, short range attack that does massive damage. The back view will fire exploding barrels behind the player. Additionally, when acquired mortars can be fired at any time, with their button generating an aiming circle that can be moved side to side and forward and backward.</p><p>Successful destruction of an enemy ship results in explosions and burning sails, but it also gives the player the ability to board the ship. Choosing to board puts the player in control of Kenway with escalating requirements for success based on the power of the ship. While schooners simple require five dead crewmen, man o' wars require 20 dead, a destroyed flag, or killed officers or gunmen, or destroyed powder stores.</p><p>Upon successful boarding, the player can choose to repair their own ship by destroying this one, lower their sea-based wanted level by converting the ship, or send the ship to the second-screen and general mini-game Kenway's Fleet.</p><p>To take down forts that reveal sections of islands on the map and make areas less dangerous, the player must attack the stationary target while it fires cannon, heavy shot, and mortars at the <em>Jackdaw. </em></p><p><strong>Present Day Abstergo Entertainment</strong></p><p>The player takes on the role of an <a href=\"/abstergo-industries/3015-2653/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2653\">Abstergo Industries</a> employee in October 2013, rather than that of <a href=\"/desmond-miles/3005-305/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-305\">Desmond Miles</a>, who is dead. These sections play out in first-person, with a tablet acting as a map and database access. Later, the player is giving the ability to hack into employee a security computers.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2583988\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"800\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 800px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2583988\"><img alt=\"The banality of evil is so meta\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"The banality of evil is so meta\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/108542/2583988-5906345605-abste.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>The banality of evil is so meta</figcaption></figure><p>Hacking consists of three variants. One is a spherical puzzle where the player needs to direct the cursor onto a green line. The second is a frogger-like grid where the player's cursor must cross multiple moving lines, some of them red and deadly, to get to the other side. The final is a mathematical graph where the player is given a final number to reach and multiple single numbers to multiply together. Some later terminals require multiple mini-games to break into. Successful hacking reveals recordings of Desmond, subject zero, and emails, books, and movies from Abstergo marketing and development.</p><p>Players can also explore the offices, finding collectible sticky notes from a deranged person, listening to employee banter, and accessing secure areas.</p><h2>Multiplayer</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2495904\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1920\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1920px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2495904\"><img alt=\"As in previous games, multiplayer centers around templar avatars, some of whom Kenway kills in the single player.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 480w\"><noscript><img alt=\"As in previous games, multiplayer centers around templar avatars, some of whom Kenway kills in the single player.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/0/2840/2495904-assassins-creed-iv-black-flag_2013_06-10-13_011.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px\" data-width=\"480\"></noscript></a><figcaption>As in previous games, multiplayer centers around templar avatars, some of whom Kenway kills in the single player.</figcaption></figure><p>The multiplayer side of Assassin's Creed 4 features six different competitive game modes, a 4 player co-op mode, and introduces Gamelab, a way to create custom matches:</p><h3>Free-For-All modes</h3><p><strong>Deathmatch</strong> - The player is given an assassination contract of another player. This mode is played on smaller maps, where the compass and lookalikes are both turned off.</p><p><strong>Wanted</strong> - Much like Deathmatch except you are working within a full map, lookalikes are turned on and you have a compass to help you find your mark.</p><p><strong>Assassinate</strong> - In this mode, no contracts are given, instead players have to discern who other real players are based on their behavior, and assassinate them.</p><h3>Team Modes</h3><p><strong>Manhunt</strong> - This mode is split into two rounds. In one round one team are the hunters and the other team is the prey. In the second round, the roles are reversed.</p><p><strong>Artifact Assault</strong> - This mode is essentially Capture The Flag. Players are not allowed to assassinate while in enemy territory.</p><p><strong>Domination</strong> - This mode is a version of Conquest, where teams must capture and hold specific points on the map.</p><p><strong>Wolfpack</strong> - This co-op mode tasks players to work together to take down NPCs within a time limit. Synchronized assassinations aren’t necessary, but if players don’t time kills properly, other targets will flee, wasting precious time as you hunt them down to finish the job.</p><h3>Gamelab</h3><p>Gamelab gives the player the opportunity to build their own custom multiplayer modes by tweaking over 200 different parameters, such as scoring, ability sets, time limits, weapons, etc. The best community-made modes will grow as they gain followers, and Ubisoft will promote the most popular ones into the public playlist.</p><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li><strong>OS:</strong> Windows Vista SP2 or Windows 7 SP1 or Windows 8 (both 32/64bit versions)</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> Intel Core2Quad Q8400 @ 2.6 GHz or AMD Athlon II X4 620 @ 2.6 GHz</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 2 GB RAM</li><li><strong>Graphics:</strong> Nvidia Geforce GTX 260 or AMD Radeon HD 4870 (512MB VRAM with shader Model 4.0 or higher)</li><li><strong>Hard Drive:</strong> 30 GB available space</li><li><strong>Sound Card:</strong> DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers</li><li><strong>Additional Notes:</strong> Windows-Compatible keyboard and mouse required, controller optional.</li></ul><h3>Recommended</h3><ul><li><strong>OS:</strong> Windows Vista SP2 or Windows 7 SP1 or Windows 8 (both 32/64bit versions)</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> Intel Core i5 2400S @ 2.5 GHz or better or AMD Phenom II x4 940 @ 3.0 GHz</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 4 GB RAM</li><li><strong>Graphics:</strong> Nvidia GeForce GTX 470 or AMD Radeon HD 5850 (1024MB VRAM with Shader Model 5.0) or better</li><li><strong>Hard Drive:</strong> 30 GB available space</li><li><strong>Sound Card:</strong> DirectX Compatible Sound Card with latest drivers</li><li><strong>Additional Notes:</strong> Supported video cards at the time of release: Nvidia GeForce GTX 260 or better and GeForce GTX 400, GTX 500, GTX 600 and GTX 700 series. AMD Radeon HD4870 or better and Radeon HD5000, HD6000 and HD7000 series. Note: Latest GeForce drivers tested: 327.23 for all series. Latest Radeon drivers tested: 13.1 for Radeon HD4000, 13.4 for Radeon HD5000, HD6000 and HD7000 series on Vista and 13.9 for Radeon HD5000, HD6000 and HD7000 series on Win7 and Win8. Laptop versions of these cards may work but are NOT officially supported.</li></ul><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2924986\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"2400\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 2400px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2924986\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px\" data-width=\"640\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg\" https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg 640w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg 2400w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg 1920w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/1/19013/2924986-ac4_complete.jpg 960w, composed by <a href=\"/brian-tyler/3040-107742/\" data-ref-id=\"3040-107742\">Brian Tyler</a>, with additional music by Steve Davis, Omar Fadel, Mike Kramer, Jeremy Lamb, Matthew Llewellyn, and Robert Lydecker, Sarah Schachner. It was released digitally by Ubisoft Music on October 14, 2013, followed by a <em>Sea Shanty Edition</em> on October 29, 2013, and <em>The Complete Edition</em> with on December 2, 2013.</p><h4><i>Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag - Original Game Soundtrack - The Complete Edition, Vol. 1</i></h4><table><tbody><tr><th>No.</th><th>Track Title</th><th>Length                 "abbreviation": "STAD",
                "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-175/",

                "name": "Google Stadia",

        "site_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/assassin-s-creed-iv-black-flag/3030-41518/"

    {
        "aliases": "WatchDogs\r\nWatch_Dogs",
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-38538/",
        "date_added": "2012-06-04 16:20:44",
        "date_last_updated": "2022-04-29 17:34:27",
        "deck": "A third-person open-world game from Ubisoft, set in an alternate version of Chicago where the entire city is connected under a single network, and a vigilante named Aiden Pearce uses it to fight back against a conspiracy.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Watch Dogs (styled Watch_Dogs in marketing) follows <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/aiden-pearce/3005-23427/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23427\">Aiden Pearce</a>, a hacker who can control the electrical grid and other systems in the city of <a href=\"/chicago/3035-293/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-293\">Chicago</a>. He possesses mobile hacking technology, which allows him to match people's real life identities with their online presences on the fly; he can also shut down mobile phone reception and listen in on phone calls.</p><p>Players can also take on the roles of other Watch Dogs and protect Aiden as he is chased by police. Multiple players exist in the city at one time, although when this multiplayer triggers or what other players would be doing when Aiden is not in trouble is unclear.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>Aiden has multiple smart-phone abilities that affect the environment of the entire city. He can hack into almost any device nearby or via camera feed to do anything from gathering information, to skimming money from their bank account, to distracting or even killing enemies. He can stop trains, raise bridges and security barriers, overload nearby fuse boxes, or black out the entire city for a short period of time to allow him to sneak by or evade enemies. In some parts of the game, he can direct companions through stealth sequences, making use of his hacking abilities to help them through to the goal.</p><p>In combat, Aiden can wield a large variety of weapons including pistols, shotguns, submachineguns, assault rifles, sniper rifles, and even a grenade launcher. He can slow down time to shoot through his special Focus ability that recharges slowly on its own. He can instantly knock out single enemies in melee range with a telescoping police baton.</p><p>As the game progresses, Aiden can learn to craft ability items through parts he picks up or purchases from shops. Everything from remote-controlled IEDs, to communications-jamming devices, to Focus-boosting pills, to a ctOS scanner that can instantly ping all nearby enemies.</p><p>Aiden also carries a persistent reputation meter through the story. When he completes contracts and performs heroic actions, the public will side with him and not call for the police. If Aiden performs enough negative actions, like killing civilians or robbing stores, Aiden's picture will appear on the news and more Chicago citizens will call the police when they see him. Aiden can run up and grab the caller's phone or use his Jam Coms ability to cut off the call.</p><p>In the world itself, Aiden can take on side missions in the form of Fixer Contracts, conduct Investigations into the seedier parts of Chicago, or use his Profiler to find and stop criminal attacks just before they happen. For money, or just for fun, Aiden can compete in drinking games, poker games, slot machines, chess matches, and even a shell game.</p><p>Aiden can take control of a wide variety of vehicles to get around Chicago, including several different kinds of cars or trucks, motorcycles, and even boats, all through hacking them with ctOS. Aiden can hijack cars like the protagonist of a <a href=\"/grand-theft-auto/3025-6/\" data-ref-id=\"3025-6\">Grand Theft Auto</a> game, or call on Jordi to leave a \"pre-owned\" copy of a requested vehicle nearby.</p><h3>Online Contracts</h3><p>Another aspect of Watch_Dogs is the online hacking, where other players can drop into the game as enemy Fixers, and vice-versa. The player sees themselves as Aiden, while the opponent sees them as another randomly-generated character. There are multiple types of Online Contracts:</p><ul><li>ctOS Mobile Challenge: One player uses an iPhone or Android app to take control of a CPD helicopter and try to stop the other player, playing Aiden Pearce, from reaching a goal by calling in various police resources and hacking abilities to stop them. This is the only Online Contract that requires both players to permit the other to invade.</li><li>Online Free Roam: Up to 8 players can join a single session and do whatever they please in Chicago.</li><li>Online Decryption: 4-8 players are split into 2 teams of Fixers. One team must grab the file and hold it to decrypt it while the enemy team must kill the file-holder to finish decrypting it themselves. More teammates near the file-holder helps to decrypt the file faster.</li><li>Online Race: 3-8 players compete in a race around Chicago in one of several varieties of vehicles, including boats and motorcycles.</li><li>Online Hacking: An invading Fixer has five minutes to locate their enemy and start installing a backdoor virus into their phone. The invaded player must then use their Profiler to find the enemy withing a shrinking area before they finish hacking and kill them. If the invader tries to kill the enemy before the download is complete, they automatically lose.</li><li>Online Tailing: Similar to Online Hacking, the invading Fixer must tail the enemy within a certain radius of them without being spotted until their meter reaches 100%. Unlike Online Hacking, the player is not restricted to a small area of the map. The invaded fixer must identify their attacker and then kill them. If the invader is discovered, they can kill their quarry or escape for partial success.</li></ul><h2>Story</h2><p>In 2013, a \"Fixer\" named Aiden Pierce lives and works in Chicago, using his great hacking skills to skim money and information from anyone he needs through a system called \"ctOS\" (Centralized Operating System) that has connected the entire city in one gigantic network. However, after stumbling on some important data he wasn't supposed to find, Aiden's niece is killed in a hit-and-run that was meant for him.</p><p>Aiden's quest for revenge on both the killer and the people who hired him takes him across Chicago, putting him at odds with an old-school mob boss, an Iraq war veteran, a hacktivist from \"DedSec,\" and a disgruntled former employee of the Blume Corporation who originally designed ctOS.</p><h2>Bad Blood</h2><p>About one year after the events of the main Watch Dogs story, Aiden and T-Bone both plan to flee from Chicago and the eyes of ctOS. However, T-Bone receives a panicked call from Tobias Frewer, former Blume colleague and co-creator of ctOS who has become homeless and mentally unstable, as he's kidnapped by Fixers working for Blume. T-Bone reluctantly finds himself staying in Chicago to help Tobias and tie up a few loose ends before he can leave Chicago for good.</p><p>Similar to Aiden, T-Bone can hack connected devices, and acquire and equip the same weapons as Aiden. T-Bone also has a special RC car that can be used to scout ahead, knock out enemies, and extend his hacking range. T-Bone also can carry out \"Street Sweeper\" missions, similar to Aiden's Fixer Contracts, that can be used to gain money, experience points, and other special perks. Some of these missions can be played in co-op mode with another player online, or repeated to get a higher score on the Leaderboards.</p><h2>E3 Demonstrations</h2><p>When the game was announced at the Ubisoft E3 2012 conference, a lengthy gameplay demonstration was shown. In this demonstration, the protagonist is shown controlling the electricity grid, which allows him to manipulate street lights. This power was used to create a pile-up to entrap a digital artist named Joseph Demarco. Another section of the demo shows him trying to gain access to a building. In order to distract the guard at the door he shuts down communications in that area of the city at which point calls are cut off for NPC's. This causes enough confusion that the guard effectively abandons his post and allows the player into the building.</p><p>At Sony's Playstation Meeting where they revealed the PS4, Ubisoft played through a brief open-world section of the game. \"There is no mission,\" they said, as Aiden walked the streets of Chicago. Most NPCs he encountered had dossiers projected for Aiden to see, revealing a homeless man to be an Iraq War veteran and a suited man to be a Tobacco Executive and Pro Life activist. Using a radial menu Aiden hacks the suited man's bank account and takes out of a nearby ATM.</p><p>Aiden cannot control everything. A security camera run by another entity was marked in red and secure. He can, however, using background histories and probabilities, detect the likelihood of events. Because a woman who had recently won a child custody battle was walking near an alley where her former husband was waiting, a crime probability bar began filling up as she walked toward the ambush. Aiden had the choice to help her and he did, interceding when the man put her at knife point. There is then an optional chase sequence where cops are alerted due to gun fire. In an alley, Aiden takes control of an electrical panel, overheats it, and takes down the man. To escape the cops, he stops an El-Line train and hops aboard.</p><p>As well as Aiden's ability to use technology to hack into systems and manipulate electrical devices, he can also employ many other skills to accomplish his goals. These include sneaking around environments and hiding behind cover, parkour-like actions to quickly traverse the city, and the ability to slow down time.</p><p>At the Sony Press Conference at E3 2013, another gameplay demo showed Pierce navigating an alerted city in order to save his colleague T-Bone from discovery. Pierce drove his car stealthily through the city streets, using the mini-map and environmental awareness to avoid patrolling police vehicles. When spotted by a helicopter search light, however, he drove to a hidden parking garage on Chicago's Lower Wacker Drive, losing the cops and taking the back entrance into a humming coffee shop. However, due to his raised alert status, the TV in the shop projected his image and Pierce had to smash the cell phone of a patron calling 911. This sequence demonstrated the real-world impact of a raised alert, where even after breaking line of sight the player must be cautious as any TV could begin the chase anew.</p><p>Pierce reaches his destination of a nondescript building where he hacks into the security cameras, then into a laptop camera to locate T-Bone, who has found a piece of computer hardware that impresses him. Pierce appears to need line of sight in order to hack and affect the world, but he can gain it through any camera in the world. In this case, he sees a screen array that he can turn on to distract the guard and give T-Bone an exit. Pierce then takes on a squad-command role as he directs T-Bone across a courtyard patrolled by guards, with T-Bone following the player's commands. Pierce can turn the lights on the parked cars on to distract guards as well.</p><p>However, they are discovered as they escape and Pierce kills a private security man before being sighted by a police helicopter.</p><p>The \"second-screen\" functionality was then revealed further as Pierce called for a random mobile user's help. This user, on a tablet, is playing at the CtOS system itself. The user shuts down the helicopter's systems for a second, momentarily disabling it but not destroying it, giving Pierce the time to get away.</p><p>He runs into some cops, though, and must employ more gadgetry. On his smart-phone select screen of abilities, he chooses total blackout, which kills every light in the city. He then uses his unexplained slow motion power to aim and shoot out the cop's knee caps before escaping on a boat down the Chicago river</p><h2>Special Editions</h2><table System:</strong> Windows Vista (SP2), Windows 7 (SP1) or Windows 8 <ul><li>64 bit OSs only.</li></ul></li><li><strong>DVD-ROM:</strong> DVD-ROM Dual Layer</li><li><strong>Hard Drive Space:</strong> 20 GB</li><li><strong>Sound:</strong> DirectX 9.0c compatible sound card with latest drivers</li><li><strong>Internet:</strong> Broadband connection and service required for multiplayer mode</li></ul><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> DirectX 11 graphics card with 1 GB Video RAM</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Quad core</li><li><strong>RAM:</strong> 4GB</li></ul><h4>Example 5770</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> AMD Phenom X4 9750</li></ul><h3>Recommended</h3><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> DirectX 11 graphics card with 2 GB Video RAM</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Eight core</li><li><strong>RAM:</strong> 8GB</li></ul><h4>Example 1</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> NVidia GTX 760</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Intel Core i7-3770</li></ul><h4>Example Ti</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Intel Core i7-3930K</li></ul><h4>Example 2</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> AMD Radeon R9 290X</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> AMD FX-9370 Eight-Core</li></ul>",
